newsitem.title: JAPAN: Aoyama Trading to acquire computer network firm.
newsitem.headline: Aoyama Trading to acquire computer network firm.

text.p: Aoyama Trading Co Ltd said on Monday that it would acquire a Hiroshima-based firm offering multimedia services such as digital printing and setting up so-called "intranet" in-house computer networks.
Aoyama, a leading operator of discount men's clothing stores, plans to buy 3.37 million shares of the 4.20 million shares to be issued by the firm through a third-party allotment, the company said.
The newly acquired firm aims for a parent current profit of one billion yen and parent sales of 15 billion yen in fiscal 1999/00, which ends on March 31, 2000, Aoyama said.
Aoyama Trading also said it would aim to publicly offer shares in the newly acquired company after March 2000.
